title: Worked Solution
text:
To calculate the wavelength of the gamma rays emitted by $$^{60}Co$$, we use the equation for the speed of light: $$c = \lambda ν$$ 
 Where:
- $$c$$ is the speed of light $$3.00 	imes 10^8 m/s$$, 
- $$\lambda$$ is the wavelength,
- $$ν$$ is the frequency $$2.83 	imes 10^{20} s^{-1}.$$ 
 We can solve for the wavelength $$\lambda$$:
$$\lambda =  rac{c}{ν}$$
Substitute the given values:
$$\lambda =  rac{3.00 	imes 10^8 m/s}{2.83 	imes 10^{20} s^{-1}} = 1.06 	imes 10^{-12} m$$. 
 To convert meters to nanometers:
$$1 m = 10^9nm$$
So,
$$\lambda = 1.06 	imes 10^{-12} m 	imes 10^9 nm/m = 1.06 	imes 10^{-3} nm$$
 Thus, the wavelength is $$1.06 	imes 10^{-3} nm$$.
